question_text: How should SMART monitoring be configured for proactive drive maintenance?
answer_options: Only check SMART data when problems occur
Run daily, weekly, or monthly automated checks to track performance trends
Check SMART data only during system boot
Monitor SMART data continuously in real-time only
correct_answer: Run daily, weekly, or monthly automated checks to track performance trends
explanation: Proactive SMART monitoring involves regular automated checks (daily, weekly, or monthly) to track drive performance trends over time. This allows you to identify degrading statistics and replace drives before they fail completely.
